meanings.definition: The quality or state of being in agreement or harmony.
meanings.sent1: The congruity of colors in the painting made it pleasing to the eye.
meanings.sent2: There was a sense of congruity between the music and the dance movements.
meanings.sent3: The congruity of the clown's outfit with the formal event was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The congruity between the team members' goals led to their success.
meanings.sent5: The congruity of the puzzle pieces fit perfectly together.

meanings.definition: The quality of being suitable or appropriate.
meanings.sent1: The congruity of the outfit for the job interview impressed the employer.
meanings.sent2: Her speech had a congruity that resonated well with the audience.
meanings.sent3: The congruity of the joke at that moment was just right for a good laugh.
meanings.sent4: The congruity of the decision with the company's values was evident to all.
meanings.sent5: The congruity of the ingredients in the recipe made it a delicious dish.

meanings.definition: The state or fact of corresponding in nature or character.
meanings.sent1: The congruity between the twins was uncanny to everyone who knew them.
meanings.sent2: There was a congruity in their personalities that made them great friends.
meanings.sent3: The congruity of the dog's bark with the song on the radio was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The congruity of the author's writing style with the classic novel was striking.
meanings.sent5: The congruity of the actor's portrayal with the character's traits was remarkable.
